definition[0]: not having the right qualities for a particular person, purpose, or situation
example[1]: The book is unsuitable for children.
example[2]: These toys are not suitable for children under 3.
example[3]: The job was considered unsuitable for women.
example[4]: Some dogs end up in totally unsuitable homes.
definition[1]: not suitable for a particular situation or purpose – used especially about someone’s behaviour or language
example[5]: Slang is not appropriate in an academic essay.
example[7]: It would not be appropriate for us to comment at this stage.
definition[2]: not the right thing or person for a particular job or purpose
example[8]: You’re using the wrong spoon – this is the soup spoon.
example[9]: She was simply the wrong person for the job.
definition[3]: not looking or seeming suitable for that place or situation
example[10]: The horse drawn carriage looks a little out of place among the busy traffic.
example[11]: At first I felt a bit out of place.
definition[4]: two ideas or things that are incompatible cannot exist or be done together. Two people who are incompatible are unlikely to have a successful relationship, because they have very different characters, beliefs etc
example[12]: He considered the role of wife and mother to be incompatible with a career.
example[13]: Why do totally incompatible people get married?
definition[5]: seeming strange and unsuitable, often in a humorous way, because of being unexpected in a particular situation or very different from its surroundings
example[14]: It seemed incongruous having a dance-band at the funeral.
example[15]: He was dressed in a three-piece suit with an incongruous tie shaped like a fish.
definition[6]: an inconvenient place or time is not suitable and causes problems for you
example[16]: He always seems to call at inconvenient times.
example[17]: The new station is inconvenient to pedestrians, because it is a long walk from the centre of town.
definition[7]: not suitable to be used for something, or not suitable to do something
example[18]: The boat is not only unfit to live in but is actually unsafe.
example[19]: The meat was declared unfit for human consumption  (=not suitable to eat).
example[20]: He claims she is an unfit mother.
example[21]: A jury decided Pryse-Jones was unfit to stand trial at court because of his mental illness.
example[22]: The house was unfit for human habitation (=not suitable to live in).
